Package space.sunqian.common.io

Interface CharIOOperator

All Known Subinterfaces:
IOOperator
@ThreadSafe public interface CharIOOperator
This interface provides I/O operations for char.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default char @Nullable []
    available(@Nonnull Reader src)
    Reads available data from the reader, continuing until no data is immediately available, and returns the string.
    default char @Nullable []
    available(@Nonnull Reader src, int len)
    Reads a specified length of data from the reader, and returns the string.
    default @Nullable String
    availableString(@Nonnull Reader src)
    Reads available data from the reader as a string, continuing until no data is immediately available, and returns the string.

    Reads a specified length of data from the reader as a string, and returns the string.

    availableTo(@Nonnull Reader src, char @Nonnull [] dst)
    Reads available data from the reader into the destination array, until the read number reaches the array's length or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

    availableTo(@Nonnull Reader src, char @Nonnull [] dst, int off, int len)
    Reads a specified length of data from the reader into the destination array, starting at the specified offset, until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

    Reads available data from the reader into the appender, until no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

    Reads a specified length of data from the reader into the appender, until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available, returns the actual number of chars read to.

    Reads available data from the reader into the destination buffer, until reaches the end of the buffer or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

    Reads a specified length of data from the reader into the destination buffer, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the buffer or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

  • Method Details

    • bufferSize

      int bufferSize()
      Returns the buffer size for I/O operations.
      Returns:
      the buffer size for I/O operations

    • read

      default char @Nullable [] read(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads all data from the reader into a new array, continuing until reaches the end of the reader, and returns the array.

      If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, or null if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • read

      default char @Nullable [] read(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the reader into a new array, and returns the array. If the specified length is 0, returns an empty array without reading. Otherwise, this method keeps reading until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the reader.

      If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns null.

      Note this method will allocate a new array with the specified length, and the excessive length may cause out of memory.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      len - the specified read length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, or null if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • string

      @Nullable default @Nullable String string(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads all data from the reader as a string, continuing until reaches the end of the reader, and returns the string.

      If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      Returns:
      a string represents the read data, or null if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • string

      @Nullable default @Nullable String string(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the reader as a string, and returns the string. If the specified length is 0, returns an empty string without reading. Otherwise, this method keeps reading until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the reader.

      If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      len - the specified read length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      a string represents the read data, or null if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      default long readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, @Nonnull @Nonnull Appendable dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads data from the reader into the appender, until reaches the end of the reader, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the appender
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      default long readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, @Nonnull @Nonnull Appendable dst, long len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the reader into the appender, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the reader, returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the appender
      len - the specified length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      default int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, char @Nonnull [] dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads data from the reader into the destination array, until the read number reaches the array's length or reaches the end of the reader, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the array's length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the destination array
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      default int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, char @Nonnull [] dst, int off, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the reader into the destination array, starting at the specified offset, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the reader, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the destination array
      off - the specified offset of the array
      len - the specified length to read
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the arguments are out of bounds
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      default int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, @Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads data from the reader into the destination buffer, until reaches the end of the reader or buffer, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the destination buffer
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      default int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, @Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer dst, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the reader into the destination buffer, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the reader or buffer, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length or destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the specified buffer
      len - the specified length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • available

      default char @Nullable [] available(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads available data from the reader, continuing until no data is immediately available, and returns the string.

      If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, possibly empty, or null if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • available

      default char @Nullable [] available(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the reader, and returns the string. If the specified length is 0, returns an empty string without reading. Otherwise, this method keeps reading until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available.

      If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      len - the specified read length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, possibly empty, or null if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableString

      @Nullable default @Nullable String availableString(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads available data from the reader as a string, continuing until no data is immediately available, and returns the string.

      If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      Returns:
      a string represents the read data, possibly empty, or null if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableString

      @Nullable default @Nullable String availableString(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the reader as a string, and returns the string. If the specified length is 0, returns an empty string without reading. Otherwise, this method keeps reading until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available.

      If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      len - the specified read length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      a string represents the read data, possibly empty, or null if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableTo

      default long availableTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, @Nonnull @Nonnull Appendable dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads available data from the reader into the appender, until no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the appender
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableTo

      default long availableTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, @Nonnull @Nonnull Appendable dst, long len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the reader into the appender, until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available, returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the appender
      len - the specified length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableTo

      default int availableTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, char @Nonnull [] dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads available data from the reader into the destination array, until the read number reaches the array's length or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the array's length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the destination array
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableTo

      default int availableTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, char @Nonnull [] dst, int off, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the reader into the destination array, starting at the specified offset, until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the destination array
      off - the specified offset of the array
      len - the specified length to read
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the arguments are out of bounds
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableTo

      default int availableTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, @Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads available data from the reader into the destination buffer, until reaches the end of the buffer or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the destination buffer
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableTo

      default int availableTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, @Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer dst, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the reader into the destination buffer, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the buffer or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length or destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the specified buffer
      len - the specified length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs
